intro: Verticordia rutilastra, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces distinctive, glandular-structured flower spikes. It is a member of the family Proteaceae and is adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its native habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
